players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Charlie was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Bob: "I am the detective. I investigated Diana last night and she is the mafioso. Vote to arrest Diana now."
Diana: "I didn't do it. Bob, you're lying — I was targeted by the killer last night, not the investigator."

You: "I don't trust Bob's sudden reveal without proof. Charlie is dead — that could fit either story. Diana says she was targeted last night; if true, Bob's claim might be false to frame her. We should ask Bob: what exact result did your investigate show and why would the killer target Diana?"

You: "I still don't fully trust Bob's claim. If Bob is the detective and investigated Diana, he should be able to explain what role he saw (mafia) and why he'd be confident — e.g., did the investigation return 'mafioso' specifically? Diana says she was targeted; that could be true even if she's mafia (mafia sometimes fake being targeted). Bob, give details: what time did you investigate, and why accuse Diana so fast? If you can't, I'm leaning to suspect Bob."

Bob: "I investigated Diana on Night 1 and my result was 'mafioso' — I saw her exact role. I revealed early because Charlie was killed and I wanted to stop the mafia before they could win numbers. Diana claiming she was targeted could be a lie to cast doubt; mafias sometimes claim to have been targeted to appear innocent. Ask Diana: who did you vote for and why? That vote record will show alignment."

Diana: "I agree with Alice — Bob's claim feels rushed and he can't prove his investigation beyond saying the word 'mafioso.' Bob, what exact phrasing did your investigation return? Investigations usually return a precise tag; did it say 'mafioso' or something else? Also, Bob, who did you vote for last round? Your vote history will show alignment. I was targeted last night — ask Alice, I said so early. We need concrete details, not quick accusations."
Votes: Alice voted for Bob, Bob voted for Diana, Diana voted for Bob
Bob was arrested
